<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="AppSpecStaticSite-outputDir">

An optional path to where the built assets will be located, relative to the build context. If not set, App Platform will automatically scan for these directory names: `_static`, `dist`, `public`.

This may be one of "tcp", "udp", or "icmp".

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="GetDomainsFilter" data-link-title="GetDomainsFilter">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L911">
        interface <strong>GetDomainsFilter</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>GetDomainsFilter</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetDomainsFilter-all">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L917">property <b>all</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>all?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of
them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure
that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetDomainsFilter-key">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L921">property <b>key</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

Filter the domains by this key. This may be one of `name`, `urn`, and `ttl`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetDomainsFilter-matchBy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L927">property <b>matchBy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>matchBy?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to
match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as
substrings to find within the string field.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetDomainsFilter-values">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L932">property <b>values</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>values: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>[];</code></pre>

A list of values to match against the `key` field. Only retrieves domains
where the `key` field takes on one or more of the values provided here.

        interface <strong>GetDropletsFilter</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>GetDropletsFilter</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetDropletsFilter-all">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1049">property <b>all</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>all?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of
them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure
that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetDropletsFilter-key">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1056">property <b>key</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

Filter the Droplets by this key. This may be one of `backups`, `createdAt`, `disk`, `id`,
`image`, `ipv4Address`, `ipv4AddressPrivate`, `ipv6`, `ipv6Address`, `ipv6AddressPrivate`, `locked`,
`memory`, `monitoring`, `name`, `priceHourly`, `priceMonthly`, `privateNetworking`, `region`, `size`,
`status`, `tags`, `urn`, `vcpus`, `volumeIds`, or `vpcUuid`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetDropletsFilter-matchBy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1062">property <b>matchBy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>matchBy?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to
match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as
substrings to find within the string field.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetDropletsFilter-values">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1067">property <b>values</b></a>

A list of values to match against the `key` field. Only retrieves Droplets
where the `key` field takes on one or more of the values provided here.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetDropletsSort-key">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1081">property <b>key</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

Sort the Droplets by this key. This may be one of `backups`, `createdAt`, `disk`, `id`,
`image`, `ipv4Address`, `ipv4AddressPrivate`, `ipv6`, `ipv6Address`, `ipv6AddressPrivate`, `locked`,
`memory`, `monitoring`, `name`, `priceHourly`, `priceMonthly`, `privateNetworking`, `region`, `size`,
`status`, `urn`, `vcpus`, or `vpcUuid`.

    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1084">
        interface <strong>GetImagesFilter</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>GetImagesFilter</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetImagesFilter-all">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1090">property <b>all</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>all?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of
them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure
that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetImagesFilter-key">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1096">property <b>key</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

Filter the images by this key. This may be one of `distribution`, `errorMessage`,
`id`, `image`, `minDiskSize`, `name`, `private`, `regions`, `sizeGigabytes`, `slug`, `status`,
`tags`, or `type`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetImagesFilter-matchBy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1102">property <b>matchBy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>matchBy?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to
match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as
substrings to find within the string field.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetImagesFilter-values">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1107">property <b>values</b></a>

A list of values to match against the `key` field. Only retrieves images
where the `key` field takes on one or more of the values provided here.

snapshots and backups and are only available within your account.

- `status`: Current status of the image
- `errorMessage`: Any applicable error message pertaining to the image

        interface <strong>GetProjectsFilter</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>GetProjectsFilter</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetProjectsFilter-all">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1291">property <b>all</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>all?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of
them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure
that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetProjectsFilter-key">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1296">property <b>key</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

Filter the projects by this key. This may be one of `name`,
`purpose`, `description`, `environment`, or `isDefault`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetProjectsFilter-matchBy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1302">property <b>matchBy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>matchBy?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to
match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as
substrings to find within the string field.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetProjectsFilter-values">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1307">property <b>values</b></a>
</h4>

A list of values to match against the `key` field. Only retrieves projects
where the `key` field takes on one or more of the values provided here.

    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>GetRecordsFilter</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRecordsFilter-all">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1372">property <b>all</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>all?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of
them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure
that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRecordsFilter-key">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1377">property <b>key</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

Filter the DNS records by this key. This may be one of `domain`, `flags`, `name`, `port`,
`priority`, `tag`, `ttl`, `type`, `value`, or `weight`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRecordsFilter-matchBy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1383">property <b>matchBy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>matchBy?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to
match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as
substrings to find within the string field.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetRecordsFilter-values">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1388">property <b>values</b></a>

A list of values to match against the `key` field. Only retrieves DNS records
where the `key` field takes on one or more of the values provided here.

A set of identifying slugs for the Droplet sizes available in this region.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="GetSizesFilter" data-link-title="GetSizesFilter">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1480">
        interface <strong>GetSizesFilter</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>GetSizesFilter</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetSizesFilter-all">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1486">property <b>all</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>all?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of
them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure
that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetSizesFilter-key">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1492">property <b>key</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

Filter the sizes by this key. This may be one of `slug`,
`regions`, `memory`, `vcpus`, `disk`, `transfer`, `priceMonthly`,
`priceHourly`, or `available`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetSizesFilter-matchBy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1498">property <b>matchBy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>matchBy?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to
match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as
substrings to find within the string field.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetSizesFilter-values">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1503">property <b>values</b></a>
</h4>

Only retrieves sizes which keys has value that matches
one of the values provided here.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetTagsFilter-all">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1651">property <b>all</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>all?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of
them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure
that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetTagsFilter-key">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1655">property <b>key</b></a>
</h4>

Filter the tags by this key. This may be one of `name`, `totalResourceCount`,  `dropletsCount`, `imagesCount`, `volumesCount`, `volumeSnapshotsCount`, or `databasesCount`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetTagsFilter-matchBy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1661">property <b>matchBy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>matchBy?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to
match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as
substrings to find within the string field.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="GetTagsFilter-values">

Only retrieves tags which keys has value that matches
one of the values provided here.

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>labels?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | {[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>};</code></pre>

A map of key/value pairs to apply to nodes in the pool. The labels are exposed in the Kubernetes API as labels in the metadata of the corresponding [Node resources](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/architecture/nodes/).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KubernetesClusterNodePool-maxNodes">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1762">property <b>maxNodes</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>maxNodes?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>;</code></pre>

If auto-scaling is enabled, this represents the maximum number of nodes that the node pool can be scaled up to.

If auto-scaling is enabled, this represents the minimum number of nodes that the node pool can be scaled down to.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="KubernetesClusterNodePool-nodeCount">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1774">property <b>nodeCount</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>nodeCount?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>;</code></pre>

The number of Droplet instances in the node pool. If auto-scaling is enabled, this should only be set if the desired result is to explicitly reset the number of nodes to this value. If auto-scaling is enabled, and the node count is outside of the given min/max range, it will use the min nodes value.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerForwardingRule-entryProtocol">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerForwardingRule-tlsPassthrough">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1873">property <b>tlsPassthrough</b></a>

A boolean value indicating whether SSL encrypted traffic will be passed through to the backend Droplets. The default value is `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerHealthcheck-checkIntervalSeconds">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerHealthcheck-healthyThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1884">property <b>healthyThreshold</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>healthyThreshold?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>;</code></pre>

The number of times a health check must pass for a backend Droplet to be marked "healthy" and be re-added to the pool. If not specified, the default value is `5`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerHealthcheck-path">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1888">property <b>path</b></a>

The path on the backend Droplets to which the Load Balancer instance will send a request.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerHealthcheck-port">

An integer representing the port on the backend Droplets on which the health check will attempt a connection.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerHealthcheck-protocol">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1896">property <b>protocol</b></a>

The protocol used for health checks sent to the backend Droplets. The possible values are `http`, `https` or `tcp`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerHealthcheck-responseTimeoutSeconds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1900">property <b>responseTimeoutSeconds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>responseTimeoutSeconds?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>;</code></pre>

The number of seconds the Load Balancer instance will wait for a response until marking a health check as failed. If not specified, the default value is `5`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerHealthcheck-unhealthyThreshold">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1904">property <b>unhealthyThreshold</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>unhealthyThreshold?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>;</code></pre>

The number of times a health check must fail for a backend Droplet to be marked "unhealthy" and be removed from the pool. If not specified, the default value is `3`.

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>LoadBalancerStickySessions</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerStickySessions-cookieName">

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cookieName?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

The name to be used for the cookie sent to the client. This attribute is required when using `cookies` for the sticky sessions type.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerStickySessions-cookieTtlSeconds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1915">property <b>cookieTtlSeconds</b></a>

The number of seconds until the cookie set by the Load Balancer expires. This attribute is required when using `cookies` for the sticky sessions type.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="LoadBalancerStickySessions-type">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1919">property <b>type</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>type?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>;</code></pre>

An attribute indicating how and if requests from a client will be persistently served by the same backend Droplet. The possible values are `cookies` or `none`. If not specified, the default value is `none`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SpacesBucketCorsRule-allowedHeaders">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SpacesBucketCorsRule-allowedMethods">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SpacesBucketCorsRule-allowedOrigins">

A list of hosts from which requests using the specified methods are allowed. A host may contain one wildcard (e.g. http://*.example.com).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SpacesBucketCorsRule-maxAgeSeconds">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SpacesBucketLifecycleRuleExpiration-date">

On a versioned bucket (versioning-enabled or versioning-suspended
bucket), setting this to true directs Spaces to delete expired object delete markers.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="SpacesBucketVersioning" data-link-title="SpacesBucketVersioning">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1993">
        interface <strong>SpacesBucketVersioning</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>SpacesBucketVersioning</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SpacesBucketVersioning-enabled">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-digitalocean/blob/eac190b60cde2d3493efc9df83bdeba20fb1e4af/sdk/nodejs/types/output.ts#L1998">property <b>enabled</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>enabled?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | <span class='kd'>false</span> | <span class='kd'>true</span>;</code></pre>

Enable versioning. Once you version-enable a bucket, it can never return to an unversioned
state. You can, however, suspend versioning on that bucket.
